titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Benjamin Harrison papers, 1888-18896
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: A brief note, 1888, by Benjamin Harrison to Charles Emory of Carthage, Jasper County, Missouri, concerning Harrison's unit in the Civil War, the 70th Regiment of Indiana Infantry; a printed copy of Harrison's inaugural address; and a printed souvenir distributed at Harrison's inaugural ball, 1889.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Benjamin Harrison Papers, 1888-18896, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Benjamin Harrison was an American politician and lawyer who served as the 23rd president of the United States from 1889 to 1893.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: A brief note, 1888, by Benjamin Harrison to Charles Emory of Carthage, Jasper County, Missouri, concerning Harrison's unit in the Civil War, the 70th Regiment of Indiana Infantry; a printed copy of Harrison's inaugural address; and a printed souvenir distributed at Harrison's inaugural ball, 1889.
